newsitem.title: ITALY: Italian separatists fly flag from Venice belltower.
newsitem.headline: Italian separatists fly flag from Venice belltower.

text.p: A small group of supporters of Italy's separatist Northern League on Sunday flew their party's flag from the top of the the belltower in Venice where an armed band staged a bizarre separatist stunt nine days ago.
Police said several dozen League supporters tried to gain access to the landmark in St Mark's Square after a rally addressed by leader Umberto Bossi.
A small group was eventually allowed up after paying the entrance fee. Once at the top, they hung out a white and green League flag, emblazoned with the symbol of a sun.
A police spokesman said no-one had been arrested. "It was just a demonstration," he said.
Venice's world-famous belltower, one of the most recognisable symbols of the city, was the scene of a dramatic siege and raid on May 9.
Eight armed men, claiming to be members of the "Venetian Liberation Army", took over the belltower for five hours until police stormed in and arrested them. No shots were fired.
The incident was linked to the 200th anniversary on May 12 of the fall of the Venetian empire.

The eight are due to stand trial from May 21 on charges of kidnapping for subversive ends after they hijacked a ferry to take them and a home-made armoured vehicle to the square. They could face a prison sentence of 30 years if convicted.
